Definition: Interviews/questionnaires of a sample of the target market. Get feedback, habits, attitudes, preferences. Data can be qualitative (opinions) or quantitative (statistics)
Watch consumers interact/behave while shopping or using product (unbiased)
Invite potential customers, ask questions and let them chat about their likes and dislikes
Use comments given to salespeople or machines (e.g. HappyOrNot in Aldi)
Invite customers to talk about products face-to-face
This is up-to-date, relevant and specific – but also costly and can be biased
